Diagnosis
	1. Rectal adenocarcinoma (mucinous type)
	Date of diagnosis
	January 2023

	Treatment aim
	Curative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	15 Aug 2023 Laparoscopic anterior resection

	Radiotherapy
	? Mar 2023 - ? Apr 2023
	Long-course chemoradiotherapy 50.4Gy in 28 fractions with concurrent capecitabine

	Chemotherapy
	? Jan 2023 - ? Mar 2023
	Neoadjuvant CAPOX 3 cycles

	Clinical studies
	None

	Current disease status
	Complete pathological response

	Current issues
	Mild anterior resection syndrome

	Summary of consultation
	I reviewed [redacted name] today for his end of treatment assessment. He has made an excellent recovery following completion of his multimodal treatment for locally advanced rectal cancer. The final histology showed complete pathological response (ypT0N0) to neoadjuvant therapy. He is managing well with diet modification for mild anterior resection syndrome. His bowel function continues to improve with 3-4 movements daily. He has returned to work full-time and has resumed regular exercise.

On examination today, his wound sites are well-healed. Digital rectal examination shows normal anastomosis with good tone. His latest CEA is normal at 2.1.

	Further investigations
	CT chest/abdomen/pelvis booked for 3 months
	Surveillance colonoscopy to be arranged at 1 year

	Medication prescribed
	None

	Follow up
	Next oncology follow up in 3 months with CT results
	Surgical follow up arranged with Mr [redacted name] in 6 weeks

	Required GP actions
	Routine health monitoring

	Summary of information given to patient
	Discussed excellent treatment response and surveillance plan. Written information provided regarding managing anterior resection syndrome.
